alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Tippecanoe; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 6:22AM EST until January 30 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River at Lafayette. .Lowland flooding will continue along the Wabash River from Lafayette down to Riverton this week from a combination of snowmelt and recent precipitation. Expected minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up amid warmer temperatures and moves downstream. Following heavier rains Thursday night over the Wabash headwaters...moderate flooding is expected at Lafayette this afternoon and evening. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Lafayette. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Extensive flooding covers many acres of agricultural land. SR 225 closed by high water. Granville Bridge Public Access Site flooded. Tippecanoe CR 950 W south of CR 75 S floods in several places from the Wabash Bottoms, Janssen Tract to Warren CR 350 N in the Black Rock Preserve Area, a distance of nearly 1.5 miles. High water affects Fort Ouiatenon area. All parks in the West Lafayette and Lafayette areas are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM EST Friday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 300 PM EST.
